citation.article-title: Halobaculum gomorrense gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel extremely halophilic archaeon from the Dead Sea.

p.s: Halobaculum (Ha.lo.ba'cu.lum. Gr. masc. n. halos, salt; L. neut. n. baculum, stick; M.L. neut. n. Halobaculum, salt stick)
Colonies are small, round, convex, entire, and translucent.
Halophilic, requiring at least 1 M NaCl for growth.
The polar lipids are glycerol diether analogs of phosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylglycerophosphate, and a single glycolipid (S-DGD-1).
Growth does not occur on single carbon sources.
Certain carbohydrates stimulate growth with acid production.
The G+C content of the type species is 70 mol%.
The type species is Halobaculum gomorrense.
